definitions.definition: (in the plural) The duties or taxes imposed on imported or exported goods.
definitions.example: Customs of £200 were due on all the wine we took back from France.

definitions.definition: (in the singular) The government department or agency that is authorised to collect the taxes imposed on imported goods.
definitions.example: Customs has pulled us over on our way for an inspection.

definitions.definition: Frequent repetition of the same behavior; way of behavior common to many; ordinary manner; habitual practice; method of doing, living or behaving.

definitions.example: The Ancient Egyptian culture had many distinctive and interesting beliefs and customs.

definitions.definition: Habitual buying of goods; practice of frequenting, as a shop, factory, etc., for making purchases or giving orders; business support.
Long-established practice, considered as unwritten law, and resting for authority on long consent; usage. See Usage, and Prescription.
